definitions: treatment and instruction received while growing up that shapes character and values
examples: Her strict upbringing influenced her disciplined approach to work
Children with a stable upbringing often develop better social skills

definitions: latest information or news about a situation or development
revised version of software that fixes bugs or adds features
examples: The manager provided weekly updates on the project's progress
Can you give me an update on your mother's condition
The latest update fixed several security vulnerabilities in the system
Download the update to access new features and improvements

definitions: act of making something current with new information or features
examples: Updating the database requires careful attention to detail
The updating of company policies happens annually

definitions: replacement of equipment or software with newer, better version
move to higher level of service, accommodation, or class
examples: The computer upgrade significantly improved processing speed
We need an upgrade to handle increased network traffic
They received a free upgrade to first class seats
The hotel upgrade included a suite with ocean view

definitions: violent or sudden change that causes great disruption or disturbance
examples: The political upheaval led to massive protests nationwide
Economic upheaval affected millions of workers globally

definitions: upward slope or incline of ground or road
examples: The uphill section of the marathon exhausted many runners
Cycling uphill requires more effort than flat terrain

definitions: soft padded textile covering fixed to furniture such as chairs and sofas
examples: The leather upholstery needed professional cleaning after years of use
She chose velvet upholstery for the vintage armchair restoration

definitions: process or cost of maintaining property or equipment in good condition
examples: The mansion's upkeep costs thousands of dollars monthly
Regular upkeep prevents expensive repairs later

definitions: area of high or hilly land above the lowlands
examples: Sheep farming thrives in the Scottish uplands
The upland regions receive more rainfall than valleys

definitions: feeling of happiness or hope that improves emotional state
upward movement of part of earth's surface
examples: The inspiring speech provided much-needed uplift to the team
Music can offer spiritual uplift during difficult times
Tectonic uplift created the mountain range millions of years ago
Geological uplift exposed ancient rock formations

definitions: part of shoe or boot above the sole
drug that stimulates the nervous system and increases alertness
examples: The leather upper separated from the sole after heavy use
These boots have waterproof uppers for wet conditions
The student took uppers to stay awake during finals week
Uppers can cause dangerous side effects when abused

definitions: large form of alphabetic letters used at sentence beginnings
examples: Type your password using both uppercase and lowercase letters
The title should be written entirely in uppercase

definitions: swinging punch delivered upward with bent arm to opponent's chin
examples: The boxer's powerful uppercut knocked out his opponent instantly
She practiced uppercuts on the heavy bag daily

definitions: piano with vertical strings and compact frame for home use
vertical structural member that provides support in construction
examples: The upright piano fit perfectly in their small apartment
She learned to play on her grandmother's upright
The fence uprights need replacing after the storm damage
Install uprights every eight feet for proper support

definitions: organized rebellion against authority or government by a group
examples: The peasant uprising overthrew the corrupt monarchy
Historical uprisings often begin with economic hardship

definitions: state of noisy excitement, confusion, or angry protest
examples: The controversial decision caused an uproar among shareholders
The classroom erupted in uproar when the fire alarm sounded

definitions: state of unhappiness, disappointment, or distress
surprising victory by underdog competitor in sports contest
examples: The news of layoffs caused widespread upset among employees
Her upset lasted several days after the argument
The team's upset victory shocked sports analysts worldwide
March Madness is famous for tournament upsets

definitions: advantageous or positive aspect of situation or investment
examples: The upside of remote work includes better work-life balance
Analysts see significant upside potential in tech stocks

definitions: person newly successful who behaves arrogantly toward established people
examples: The young upstart challenged industry veterans with bold ideas
Some viewed the tech entrepreneur as an upstart disrupting tradition

definitions: sudden large increase in amount or strength of something
examples: The hospital experienced an upsurge in emergency cases
Economic recovery brought an upsurge in consumer spending

definitions: absorption of substances by living tissue or technical system
rate at which people accept and begin using something new
examples: Oxygen uptake increases during intense physical exercise
The plant's nutrient uptake depends on soil conditions
The uptake of renewable energy has accelerated globally
Vaccine uptake varied significantly across different regions

definitions: small increase or slight upward trend in activity or value
examples: Market analysts noted an uptick in consumer confidence
There's been an uptick in flu cases this winter

definitions: residential area in northern or outer part of city
examples: They moved uptown to escape downtown congestion
The uptown neighborhood features luxury apartments and boutiques

definitions: improvement or recovery especially in economic conditions or business
examples: The economic upturn created thousands of new jobs
Retailers hope for an upturn during holiday shopping season

definitions: heavy radioactive metallic element used as nuclear fuel and weapons
examples: Uranium mining poses significant environmental risks
Nuclear power plants require enriched uranium to operate

definitions: process by which towns and cities form and grow as people move from rural areas
examples: Rapid urbanization creates infrastructure challenges for developing nations
Urbanization has transformed formerly agricultural regions into metropolitan areas

definitions: mischievous child typically poor and raggedly dressed
small marine animal with spherical shell covered in spines
examples: Street urchins begged for coins outside the theater
Dickens often wrote about Victorian urchins
Sea urchins are considered delicacies in Japanese cuisine
Divers must avoid stepping on poisonous sea urchins

definitions: tube that carries urine from bladder to outside of body
examples: Urinary tract infections can affect the urethra causing painful urination
The male urethra is longer than the female urethra

definitions: strong desire or impulse to do something
examples: She felt an overwhelming urge to call her mother
The urge to travel motivated his career choices

definitions: quality of requiring immediate action or attention due to importance
examples: The doctor stressed the urgency of starting treatment immediately
Climate change demands urgency in policy implementation

definitions: act of trying to persuade someone strongly to do something
examples: Despite repeated urgings, he refused to see a doctor
The committee's urgings led to policy changes

definitions: plumbing fixture used by men for urination typically mounted on walls
examples: The stadium installed waterless urinals to conserve water
Public restrooms often have multiple urinals in rows

definitions: process of discharging urine from the bladder through the urethra
examples: Frequent urination can indicate diabetes or infection
Painful urination requires immediate medical attention

definitions: liquid waste product filtered from blood by kidneys
examples: Laboratory tests analyze urine for signs of disease
Dark urine may indicate dehydration or liver problems

definitions: large decorative vase typically with pedestal or base
container for holding cremated human remains
examples: The ancient Greek urn displayed intricate mythological scenes
Fresh flowers filled the ceramic urn on the mantle
The family chose a brass urn for their father's ashes
Memorial urns can be personalized with engravings

definitions: degree to which something can be used easily and effectively
examples: Software developers prioritize usability in interface design
Product usability testing revealed several design flaws

definitions: way in which something is used or consumed
customary manner of using words in language
examples: Monitor your data usage to avoid overage charges
Industrial usage accounts for most water consumption
Modern usage accepts ending sentences with prepositions
The dictionary includes notes on historical usage

definitions: act of employing something for practical purpose
purpose for which something can be employed
examples: The use of smartphones has transformed communication
Proper use of tools prevents workplace injuries
This old box might have some use in the garage
What's the use of arguing about it now

definitions: person who uses or operates something especially computer or service
person who regularly takes illegal drugs
examples: The software update affects millions of users worldwide
New users receive a tutorial during setup
Rehabilitation programs help drug users overcome addiction
Heavy users often develop tolerance to substances

definitions: person who shows people to seats at theater or stadium
person who assists with seating and collection at church services
examples: The usher directed us to our seats in the balcony
Wedding ushers help coordinate the ceremony procession
Church ushers greet congregants at the door each Sunday
The head usher coordinates volunteer schedules

definitions: act of taking power or position illegally or by force without right
examples: The military's usurpation of power violated constitutional law
Historical usurpations often led to civil wars

definitions: person who takes power or position illegally or by force
examples: The usurper claimed divine right to rule the kingdom
History remembers both successful usurpers and failed ones

definitions: implement for eating such as knife, fork, or spoon
tool or container used in kitchen for cooking preparation
examples: Place utensils on the right side of each plate
The restaurant provides disposable utensils for takeout
Kitchen utensils hung from hooks above the stove
Silicone utensils won't scratch nonstick cookware

definitions: company providing essential services like electricity or water
quality of being useful or practical
computer program that performs specific system task
examples: The utility company announced planned power outages for maintenance
Monthly utility bills increased due to cold weather
The utility of this feature becomes apparent with regular use
Economists measure utility in consumer satisfaction
Run the disk utility to check for errors
System utilities help maintain computer performance

definitions: action of making practical and effective use of something
examples: Hospital bed utilization reached ninety percent during flu season
Better resource utilization reduces operational costs

definitions: greatest or most extreme degree or amount possible
examples: This matter requires the utmost discretion and care
She tried her utmost to finish before deadline

definitions: imagined place or state where everything is perfect
examples: The novel describes a technological utopia free from poverty
Many attempted to create utopian communities throughout history

definitions: spoken word, statement, or vocal sound expressed by person
examples: Every utterance was recorded for linguistic analysis
The baby's first utterances brought joy to parents

definitions: unfilled job position available for hiring
unoccupied room in hotel or rental property
examples: The company has several vacancies in engineering department
Job vacancies increased as the economy recovered
The motel's neon sign flashed 'No Vacancy' all weekend
Apartment vacancies are rare in this neighborhood

definitions: period of time devoted to rest or travel away from work or home
examples: Their summer vacation included visits to five national parks
Employees receive three weeks paid vacation annually
